author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Income Tax Department has set a IT collection target of Rs. 569 crore for the current year for the Salem region spread over in the four western districts of Salem, Namakkal, Dharmapuri and Krishnagiri.

The region has already achieved a collection of Rs. 315 so far during the current year, M. Tirumala Kumar, Principal Commissioner of Income Tax, Salem, said while speaking at a programme to create awareness on the Income Tax collection proposal here on Thursday.

The Salem region managed to achieve a collection of Rs. 476 crore last year (2014-15), he said. Mr. Tirumala Kumar said that Income Tax collection played a major role in the implementation of various welfare projects, particularly the education and health schemes. Referring to the need for increasing the number of IT assessees, the Principal Commissioner said that of the four crore people in Canada, over 3.2 crore are IT assessees. In India which accounted for a population of 125 crores, only four crore have been brought under the IT net.

The IT collection which remained at Rs. 88 crore at the time of Independence has increased manifold and is now put at Rs. seven lakh crore, thanks to the various initiatives of the department.

Procedures simplified

To encourage more people to come forward voluntarily to remit the income tax, the Department has simplified the procedures, Mr. Tirumala Kumar said and called upon the people to take advantage of the same for filing their returns and the tax.

N. Sukumar, Joint Commissioner of Income Tax, Namakkal Range, and other officials participated in the meeting, which was attended by a large number of people belonging to different sections of the society.
title: Rs. 569 crore IT collection target fixed for Salem region
